page.title: 07A Crofting Year in Tongue
page.content: 'Spring is avery important time in the crofting year because the crofter has to work very hard. First the plough ing has to be done with a tractor to pull the plough. Sometimes the crofter harrows the ground with a frame that has little spikes on it. He does not do any sowing until the fertiliser is put on, this can be artificial fertil iser. Then corn, grass seed and potatoes are sown. Then he hopes the sun and rain will come to make things grow. Weeds appear and have to be taken out by hand or by using a hoe. In autumn the crofter begins the harv est. First he makes sure the crops are ripe and yellow. Thwn he cuts the corn with a combine harvester that takes the grain away from the straw. Then he makes the straw into bales and stores them in his barn. Then when the weath er is good he lifts the potatoes.
